page.title: 14THE SCHOOL - POTT SHRIGLEY
page.content: This Church of England aided primary school is unique in renting its premises from the Village Hall. The rent is raised by Rose Queen fetes and by gift from the Parochial Church Council. The 34 children are educated by 2 teachers who have some part time help. The curriculum includes the teaching of computer studies and radio and television are used as well as other teaching aids. Various sports are taught and team games are played competitively against other schools. There are two classrooms and a hall where meals, sent ready cooked from Poynton, are eaten. The surrounding countryside, village cricket pitch, & playground serve for outdoor pursuits. The Parent Teachers Association raises money for extra educational and sporting equipment. Educational and social outings are similarly funded.
